defs.docs:
Coverage rasterization for lines, quadratic & cubic beziers.
 Useful for drawing .otf font glyphs.

attributes.value: / Coverage rasterization for lines, quadratic & cubic beziers.
/ # let [l0, l1, q0, q1, q2, c0, c1, c2, c3] = [ab_glyph_rasterizer::point(0.0, 0.0); 9];
/ // iterate over the resultant pixel alphas, e.g. save pixel to a buffer

defs.name: Rasterizer
defs.docs: Coverage rasterizer for lines, quadratic & cubic beziers.

attributes.value: / Coverage rasterizer for lines, quadratic & cubic beziers.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Allocates a new rasterizer that can draw onto a `width` x `height` alpha grid.

attributes.value: / Allocates a new rasterizer that can draw onto a `width` x `height` alpha grid.

defs.name: reset
defs.value: pub fn reset(&mut Self, usize, usize)
defs.docs:
Resets the rasterizer to an empty `width` x `height` alpha grid. This method behaves as if
 the Rasterizer were re-created, with the advantage of not allocating if the total number of
 pixels of the grid does not increase.

attributes.value: / Resets the rasterizer to an empty `width` x `height` alpha grid. This method behaves as if
/ the Rasterizer were re-created, with the advantage of not allocating if the total number of
/ pixels of the grid does not increase.

defs.name: clear
defs.docs:
Clears the rasterizer. This method behaves as if the Rasterizer were re-created with the same
 dimensions, but does not perform an allocation.

attributes.value: / Clears the rasterizer. This method behaves as if the Rasterizer were re-created with the same
/ dimensions, but does not perform an allocation.

defs.name: dimensions
defs.docs: Returns the dimensions the rasterizer was built to draw to.

attributes.value: / Returns the dimensions the rasterizer was built to draw to.

defs.name: draw_line
defs.value: pub fn draw_line(&mut Self, Point, Point)
defs.docs: Adds a straight line from `p0` to `p1` to the outline.

attributes.value: / Adds a straight line from `p0` to `p1` to the outline.

defs.name: draw_quad
defs.value: pub fn draw_quad(&mut Self, Point, Point, Point)
defs.docs: Adds a quadratic Bézier curve from `p0` to `p2` to the outline using `p1` as the control.

attributes.value: / Adds a quadratic Bézier curve from `p0` to `p2` to the outline using `p1` as the control.

defs.name: draw_cubic
defs.value: pub fn draw_cubic(&mut Self, Point, Point, Point, Point)
defs.docs:
Adds a cubic Bézier curve from `p0` to `p3` to the outline using `p1` as the control
 at the beginning of the curve and `p2` at the end of the curve.

attributes.value: / Adds a cubic Bézier curve from `p0` to `p3` to the outline using `p1` as the control
/ at the beginning of the curve and `p2` at the end of the curve.

defs.name: for_each_pixel
defs.value: pub fn for_each_pixel<O: FnMut(usize, f32) -> ()>(&Self, O)
defs.docs: Run a callback for each pixel `index` & `alpha`, with indices in `0..width * height`.

attributes.value: / Run a callback for each pixel `index` & `alpha`, with indices in `0..width * height`.
/ An `alpha` coverage value of `0.0` means the pixel is not covered at all by the glyph,
/ whereas a value of `1.0` (or greater) means the pixel is totally covered.
/ let mut pixels = vec![0u8; width * height];

defs.name: for_each_pixel_2d
defs.value: pub fn for_each_pixel_2d<O: FnMut(u32, u32, f32) -> ()>(&Self, O)
defs.docs: Run a callback for each pixel x position, y position & alpha.

attributes.value: / Run a callback for each pixel x position, y position & alpha.
/ # impl Img { fn set_pixel(&self, x: u32, y: u32, a: u8) {} }
